GlycosylationModelBase package

This module contains base class and shared class for steady-state and dynamic N-linked glycosylation simulation.

Submodules

GlycosylationModelBase.GlycosylationDerivative module

GlycosylationModelBase.GlycosylationDerivative.steady_state_inner_derivative(z, y, x, p, fp, is_dynamic=False)[source]

Compute the derivative of steady state mechanistic Glycosylation model dy/dz

Parameters

  • z (float) – Golgi dimensionless length

  • y (array) – state (Oligsaccharides, nucleotide sugars in Golgi apparatus and nucleotides in Golgi apparatus)

  • x (array) – perfusion cell culture related data (ammonium, Manganese chloride and Nucleotide sugar in cytosol)

  • p (GlycosylationModelParamClass) – N-linked glycosylation model parameters

  • fp (GlycosylationNetwork) – N-linked glycosylation network

Return array deriv

derivatives of N-linked glycosylation models

class GlycosylationModelBase.GlycosylationModelParams.Network(Man1: numpy.ndarray, Man2: numpy.ndarray, GnT1: numpy.ndarray, GnT2: numpy.ndarray, FucT: numpy.ndarray, GalT: numpy.ndarray, SiaT: numpy.ndarray)[source]

GlycosylationModelBase.GlycosylationNetwork module

class GlycosylationModelBase.GlycosylationNetwork.GlycosylationNetwork(nn=3, nns=4, nos=33, network_data_path='data/Network Description.csv')[source]

Bases: object

Class for Glycosylation network. This class will build the network from a network description file

Parameters

  • nn (int) – number of nucleotides in the Golgi apparatus

  • nns (int) – number of nucelotide sugars in the Golgi apparatus

  • nos (int) – number of oligsaccharides

  • network_data_path (str) – data path for glycosylation network

eqkmm(kfj, ej, osi, kdi, sumterm1, sumterm2)[source]

Michealis–Menten kinetics (ManI and ManII) Eq. 25 of Villiger et. al.

eqkrobb(kfj, ej, nsgolgik, osi, kdk, kdi, sumterm, osi1, kdi1, ngolgik, kdnk)[source]

Random-order bi-bi kinetics (FucT and SiaT). Eq. 27 of Villiger et. al.

eqksobb(kfj, ej, mn, nsgolgik, osi, kdmn, kdk, kdi, sumterm, osi1, kdi1, ngolgik, kdnk)[source]

Sequential-order bi-bi kinetcis with Mn as cofactor (GnTI, GnTII, and GalT). Eq. 26 of Villiger et. al.

GlycosylationModelBase.Reaction module

GlycosylationModelBase.Reaction.any_column(data)[source]
GlycosylationModelBase.Reaction.compute_stoichiometric_coefficient_reaction(z, y, x, p, fp)[source]

Compute stoichiometric coefficient and reaction rates of N-linked glycosylation models. It includes Equation 19-29 from Villiger et. al.

Reference: Villiger, T. K., Scibona, E., Stettler, M., Broly, H., Morbidelli, M., & Soos, M. (2016). Controlling the time evolution of mAb N‐linked glycosylation‐Part II: Model‐based predictions. Biotechnology progress, 32(5), 1135-1148.

Parameters

  • y (array) – state (Oligsaccharides, nucleotide sugars in Golgi apparatus and nucleotides in Golgi apparatus)

  • z (array) – Golgi dimensionless length

  • x (array) – cell culture related data (ammonium, Manganese chloride and Nucleotide sugar in cytosol)

  • p (GlycosylationModelParamClass) – N-linked glycosylation model parameters

  • fp (GlycosylationNetwork) – N-linked glycosylation network

Return list

flowrate of Nucleotide sugars into the Golgi, stoichiometric coefficient and reaction rates of N-linked glycosylation models
